intro: Psychotria nubicola, commonly known as the cloud forest Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the montane regions of Central and South America, particularly in cloud forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing in association with other understory plants. Psychotria nubicola is notable for its role in supporting local biodiversity and its potential ethnobotanical uses.
